title: 114_hr553
content: The amendment allows home school expenses to be considered qualified education expenses for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts. It also eliminates the contribution limitation for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts. The amendment eliminates the contribution limitation for Coverdell Education Savings Accounts and prohibits excess contributions to ensure funds cover qualified education expenses. Effective starting taxable years after December 31, 2014. SEC. 3. 529 programs for pre-kindergarten, elementary, and secondary education expenses. Section 529(e)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include qualified education expenses for pre-kindergarten, elementary, and secondary education in addition to higher education expenses. The term 'qualified pre-kindergarten, elementary, and secondary education expenses' now includes tuition, fees, tutoring, special needs services, books, supplies, equipment, room, and board for students at public, private, or religious schools. Expenses for room and board, uniforms, transportation, and supplementary items and services required by a school, as well as expenses for computer technology, equipment, and Internet access for the beneficiary and their family during school years, are now considered qualified education expenses. The term 'school' includes pre-kindergarten through grade 12 institutions and is considered an eligible educational institution for qualified education expenses. Section 529 of the Code is amended to replace 'qualified higher education' with 'qualified education'. The effective date of these amendments is specified. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.
